results.title: Wendy
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Wendy has her pregnancy terminated by abortion and the film reveals some of her reactions, her boyfriend’s and those of her mother to this situation. The film concludes with Wendy emphasising the importance of communications in teenage relationships. Cinemaphotography by Dean Semler. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Weekend
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Looks at the behaviour of a group of young teenagers over what is for them a typical weekend. The focus is on the peer group role in their lives and its significance in shaping expectations the boys and girls have of each other. (Includes footage of John Paul Young performing on stage.)

results.title: Kerry
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Kerry is a fifteen year old girl who leaves home and lives with her boyfriend. She becomes pregnant and returns to her family. The film considers some of the effects that the pregnancy and the decision to keep the baby have on Kerry’s relationship with her family and her boyfriend.

results.title: Jenny
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
A film focusing on a teenage girl in a homosexual relationship. Jenny discusses her perception of the ‘gay’ scene, her relationship and how she feels other people perceive her life-style.

results.title: Disco
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
This film considers social and sexual expectations and attitudes of teenagers attending a disco. Their perceptions of male and female roles, the similarities and differences are portrayed through their behaviour, conversation and dress. Cinematography by Mike Edols.

results.title: Brad
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Brad identifies himself as a homosexual. The film examines his reactions to homosexuality and the importance of relationships with other males. His mother expresses her feelings about Brad’s sexuality; he is shown in his employment and enjoying himself socially.

results.title: Establishing new plants
results.creator_credit: Ivo Burum, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Discusses how sexual reproduction, plant propagation and factors affecting plant growth are vital in establishing new plants for commercial production. Dormancy, the means by which a seed may survive in conditions where a plant may not, and different methods of seed scarification used to commence germination are also examined. Highlights methods of propagation including obtaining cuttings, grafting, budding and the use of rootstock.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivo Burum, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Friends and foes
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
There are major biotic factors which affect plant growth including the impact of pests and diseases and the competition with other plants for light and resources. Highlighted are some of the techniques developed to control these problems and the beneficial relationships which exist between plants and living organisms. A contemporary approach known as Integrated Pest Management looks at various methods used to control pests and disease while minimising environmental impact.

results.title: Soil
results.creator_credit: Robin Wischusen, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
A plant must absorb essential nutrients from the soil and how a plant utilises essential nutrients and trace elements through the fixed, exchangeable and soluble nutrient pools is shown. The Nitrogen cycle is also explained. Roots absorb soil nutrients and depending on whether there is an excess or defecit of nitrogen, the soil is either acidic or alkaline. Soil texture is explained and the modern day use of hydroponics.
